name: lateadopter
text: The intermittent appearance of alt text in Acheworld is like the early days of Achewood itself, when only some of the strips had alt text, and that one time the alt text writer had a bad hangover and got fired for crapping out once too often.  Good times!  Thanks, Assetbar!

name: babachewy
text: Every dollar he can get his hands on is worth a long pull of Thunderbird in the right parts of town.

name: gouldgonewild
text:
What's the word?
Thunderbird.
What's the action?
Satisfaction?
Who's gonna pay?
Phillipe.

name: stuart
text:
What's the price?
FORTY TWICE! Quite!

name: soticoto
text: Schfifty-five?

name: spinynorman
text:
Among the strangest things I ever heard
Was when a friend of mine said man, lets get some thunderbird
I said whats that? he just started to grin
Slobbered on his shirt, his eyes got dim
He said you got fifty-nine cents?

I said yeah, I got a dollar, but dont be a smart-aleck
I aint gonna spend it on no indian relic
And he said thunderbirds not an old indian trinket,
Its a wine, man, you take it home and drink it.
I said it sure dont sound like wine to me
And he said hed bet me the change from my dollar

God bless you, Townes.

name: apocowarg
text: Thunderbird! The wine so bad it made the news.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Unsafe at any speed!

name: fineoakstructure
text: That Willie Nelson is still alive (and just puttin' out shit to pay the taxman) and Townes is dead really gets me cross.

name: spinynorman
text: Well, I don't think Townes would have it any other way. I'm pretty sure that man just wanted to die.

name: boredom_man
text:
Once he had a ma, he even had a pa
He beat her with a belt once 'cause she cried
She told him to take care of me, headed down to Tennessee

name: boredom_man
text: 'kay I basically lost track of my pronouns there

name: selbencoirlo
text:
I know, I know, I said that I would quit
Alright, I promise, no more after this
You don't know how I've tried
To forget what it was like
I remember now
I remember now
Why they called it Thunderbird
Why they called it Thunderbird

Man oh man my throat is dry
Man are you thinking what I
am, well what about it then
Before you fall you have to learn to crawl
You can't see heaven when you're standing tall
To get the whole moon sky
On the ground you have to lie
I remember now
I remember now
Why they called it Thunderbird
Why they called it Thunderbird

We like fun me and my girl
We'll have fun fun fun until
T-Bird takes her dad away
I know I know I said that I'd desist
Alright I promise no more after this
Not to be what I was like
Not to soar across the sky
Spread my thunder wings and fly
Spread my thunder wings and fly
I remember now
I remember now
Why they called it Thunderbird
Why they called it Thunderbird

name: solobuttons
text: CUNTY. That's a five-Beefer.

name: oltanya
text: Cunty's struggles emulate the little-town-rejects-Walmart internal conflict in all of us.  The corporate world, or the homeliness of home?  But it's all for naught when his story gets shit on.

name: solobuttons
text: I like the way Lyle thinks that the book being in the hallway is a valid excuse for going potty on it.

name: chewy
text: Ho-ho-ho. Cunty the Sardine. Philippe = <3

name: spinynorman
text: I like the strip not only because of it's use of the word "cunt," the atomic bomb of swears, but it also finally answers my question about the spelling of the word "damnedest." That extra "e" catches me every time.

name: aperson
text: But... put a y on the end of cunt and suddenly it bespeaks of plucky cuteness!

name: someone3
text: this actually works with most words.

name: lateadopter
text:
I think it sounds like an adjective. As in, "This smells cunty," or "O'Keefe paintings look very cunty to me."

We also have the word "cocky," but they are not similar words. If a man is said to be cocky, we understand that he is confident to the point of hubris. If a woman is said to be cunty, do you first think, "Oh, she's empowered," or "God, I hope someone puts her in her place!" Or, perhaps, "Can I get some?"

Ah, fun with language.

text: I like how Lyle's defense for crapping on Phillipe's book was that it was in the hallway. Like the hallway is his private toilet, or something.

text: In this strip, the stuffed tiger feels bad about defecating on the young otter's literature, but not so bad as to pass up a chance at taking money from him.

name: perilon
text: Inspiration for the character, and especially for the sleeping habits, of Cunty may come straight from the observed behavior of Todd .

name: fineoakstructure
text: I was thinking the exact same thing.

name: hereward
text: I love imagining Lyle's mindset as he works on the little book. He cares enough about his work to do a fair storyline and calligraphy, but he still has lots of internal frustration and world-hatred or whatever which he expresses in calling the sardine CUNTY. But he makes an effort at children-style writing in the subtitle. A morass of contradictions.

text: Nice use of 'morass'.
